articles.description: A new government order will force virtual private networks to store user data for five years or longer.
articles.content: In India, virtual private network companies will be required to collect extensive customer data -- and maintain it for five years or more -- under a new national directive from the country's Computer… [+3429 chars]

articles.title: Google-backed neobank Open becomes unicorn with new funding - TechCrunch
articles.description: The Bengaluru-headquartered neobank Open has raised a new round of funding at a valuation of $1 billion, it said.
articles.content:
India has 100 unicorns now. The Bengaluru-headquartered neobank Open entered the coveted club on Monday with a new funding round, it said.

articles.title: Tata Motors eyes $500-700 million business from electric trucks and buses - Economic Times
articles.description: The transition toward commercial EVs will be bigger than its entry into the electric personal vehicle segment, as commercial EVs will potentially generate $500-700 million (Rs 3,800-5,350 crore) in business in a couple of years for the company.
articles.content:
Encouraged by its success in the electric passenger vehicle space, Tata Motors is preparing for electrification of a part of its commercial vehicle portfolio.
